result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryar Ann Hegstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryar Ann Hegstad is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryar Ann Hegstad was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

filed by ADA Smestad. bph
and Motion filed by ADA Smestad.  Includes 22CM208 & 22CM28. bph

8:31 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Bryar Ann Hegstad in court.  Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Bryar Ann Hegstad. Includes 22CM28 & 22CM208. Court reviews file.  Atty Dolfi states DE has to complete an AODA so asking to push this out to allow DE to get the funds together to start the program.  Court states bond is on file, willing to send some of that to the facility to help with funds, Atty Dolfi to inform the Court if that is necessary. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 8:38 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:35 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DE:  Bryar Ann Hegstad appeared. INCLUDES 22CM28 and 22CM208. Order of Appointment of Counsel needed on 22CM208, Atty. Dolfi will look into the issue. Atty. Dolfi states that an offer has been received, anticipates acceptance of offer, requests plea/sentencing hearing. DE confirms address and phone number. Adjourned: 10:39 AM. kma  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

**AMENDED**

- Bond on file in 22CM28

- Includes 22CM28 & 22CM208

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.I.T.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

02:01 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF:  Bryar Ann Hegstad appeared.  Includes 22CM28 (PTC) and 22CM208 (INIT).  On 22CM208-   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.   On 22CM28, ADA Becker states discovery was sent to Atty Dolfi, but with new file will need to send more to her now that she's been appointed to both cases.  State to file new discovery within 10 business days.  Settlement offer to be sent by 6/3/22.  Court will include both cases on an amended bond, conditions will be the same.  Adjourned 2:06 PM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
